qualitative_analysis.article_title: A Pricing Framework for Software-as-a-Service
qualitative_analysis.quote: SaaS is outsourced software, meaning that both technology infrastructure and management - hardware, software and professional services - are contracted out to software vendors.
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes outsourcing of technology infrastructure as prerequisite for SaaS model, aligning with cloud infrastructure and service-oriented delivery.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: A Pricing Framework for Software-as-a-Service
qualitative_analysis.quote: SaaS is single versioned, meaning that there is only one version of software being accessed by every client at any moment in time. The multi-tenant architecture of SaaS benefits both clients and vendors alike
qualitative_analysis.justification: Explicitly identifies multi-tenant architecture and single-version deployment as key prerequisites for SaaS business model.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: A Pricing Framework for Software-as-a-Service
qualitative_analysis.quote: software deployed as a hosted service and accessed over the Internet
qualitative_analysis.justification: Internet connectivity and remote hosting are fundamental prerequisites for SaaS delivery model.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: A Pricing Framework for Software-as-a-Service
qualitative_analysis.quote: in order to retain a sizeable pool of clients and achieve economies of scale

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Selection of the Proper Revenue and Pricing Model for SaaS

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Selection of the Proper Revenue and Pricing Model for SaaS

qualitative_analysis.article_title: How Service Offerings and Operational Maturity Influence the Viability of Health Information Exchanges
qualitative_analysis.quote: capability development depends on trained manpower, efficient processes, and business orientation, which in turn will steer the HIE toward revenue generation
qualitative_analysis.justification: Trained personnel and efficient processes identified as organizational prerequisites for HIE capability development.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: How Service Offerings and Operational Maturity Influence the Viability of Health Information Exchanges
qualitative_analysis.quote: CORHIO engaged hospital stakeholders, as the first entities joining the network, to ensure a critical mass of clinical information was available to community providers
qualitative_analysis.justification: Critical mass of participants identified as prerequisite for creating sufficient information value in HIE.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Mobile ticketing services in the Northern Europe: Critical business model issues
qualitative_analysis.quote: SMS tickets can only be bought by people having subscription with local mobile operators
qualitative_analysis.justification: Mobile phone subscription identified as prerequisite for SMS ticketing service access.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Mobile ticketing services in the Northern Europe: Critical business model issues
qualitative_analysis.quote: Customers using feature phones cannot buy an app ticket
qualitative_analysis.justification: Smartphone ownership identified as device prerequisite for in-app ticketing functionality.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Mobile ticketing services in the Northern Europe: Critical business model issues
qualitative_analysis.quote: changes in regulation: (1) a license became mandatory in order to handle digital payments, and (2) payment service providers were required to know the identity of persons making payments to prevent "money laundry"
qualitative_analysis.justification: Regulatory compliance and licensing identified as organizational prerequisites for payment handling.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: The effect of free sampling strategies on freemium conversion rates
qualitative_analysis.quote: Whereas the marginal cost of free users in social networks or online games is almost zero, it is often very costly to maintain them in other contexts such as in the case of music services, where royalties have to be paid or in cloud storage services where storage has to be held.
qualitative_analysis.justification: Low marginal cost identified as prerequisite for sustainable freemium model in different service contexts.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: The effect of free sampling strategies on freemium conversion rates
qualitative_analysis.quote: Under such circumstances, payments from premium users often in combination with advertising revenues through free users are not necessarily sufficient to subsidize the free version
qualitative_analysis.justification: Revenue sufficiency from premium users and advertising identified as financial prerequisite for freemium viability.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Give Away Your Digital Services: Leveraging Big Data to Capture Value
qualitative_analysis.quote: By the end of 2016, 2.16 billion people will have smartphones
qualitative_analysis.justification: Smartphone penetration identified as market prerequisite enabling data collection capabilities.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Give Away Your Digital Services: Leveraging Big Data to Capture Value
qualitative_analysis.quote: The emerging model, typified by Twitter's Firehose data product, relies on the emergence of big data and tools for managing it
qualitative_analysis.justification: Big data management tools identified as prerequisite for data-based business models.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Give Away Your Digital Services: Leveraging Big Data to Capture Value
qualitative_analysis.quote: We then eliminated duplicate results and those apps with fewer than 5 million downloads from Google Play at the time of the initial search, since big data effects would likely be negligible under that threshold
qualitative_analysis.justification: Large user base (5+ million) identified as prerequisite threshold for big data effects and value capture.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Give Away Your Digital Services: Leveraging Big Data to Capture Value
qualitative_analysis.quote: smartphones, with their embedded sensors and wide range of apps, can gather a huge volume and variety of data with incredible speed, and the ubiquitous connectivity they provide allows for that data to be collected and aggregated in real time
qualitative_analysis.justification: Ubiquitous connectivity and sensor-enabled devices identified as prerequisites for real-time data aggregation.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Making Digital Freemium Business Models a Success: Predicting Customers' Lifetime Value via Initial Purchase Information
qualitative_analysis.quote: One can expect a similar effect with freemium services that do not exhibit sufficient incentives and features on which to spend credits
qualitative_analysis.justification: Sufficient in-app features identified as prerequisite for sustaining repeated purchases in freemium model.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Making Digital Freemium Business Models a Success: Predicting Customers' Lifetime Value via Initial Purchase Information
qualitative_analysis.quote: gaming and dating platforms are social networks that exhibit positive network effects which eventually increase users' willingness to pay
qualitative_analysis.justification: Network effects infrastructure identified as prerequisite increasing user engagement and payment willingness.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Understanding the influence of absorptive capacity and ambidexterity on the process of business model change – the case of on-premise and cloud-computing software
qualitative_analysis.quote: interviewees of case companies that had no experience with on-demand software mentioned that a top priority is extending internal knowledge and integrating external knowledge regarding Web technologies (e.g. Ajax and HTML5) and on-demand software delivery (e.g. capacity management, pricing methods and support)
qualitative_analysis.justification: Web technology knowledge and on-demand delivery competencies identified as organizational prerequisites for SaaS.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Understanding the influence of absorptive capacity and ambidexterity on the process of business model change – the case of on-premise and cloud-computing software
qualitative_analysis.quote: all case companies but one now use agile software-development methods supporting iterative and incremental progress, such as Scrum
qualitative_analysis.justification: Agile development methods identified as organizational prerequisite for cloud service continuous updates.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Understanding the influence of absorptive capacity and ambidexterity on the process of business model change – the case of on-premise and cloud-computing software
qualitative_analysis.quote: the business model innovation failed at the time owing to low broadband penetration and inadequate software design
qualitative_analysis.justification: Broadband penetration identified as infrastructure prerequisite; its absence causes business model failure.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Transition to the Cloud: A Vendor Perspective
qualitative_analysis.quote: The decision for the transition was on the one hand partially triggered by the macro environment with increasing market demands and technological maturity
qualitative_analysis.justification: Technological maturity and market demands identified as macro prerequisites for cloud transition decision.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Transition to the Cloud: A Vendor Perspective
qualitative_analysis.quote: organizational preparedness, since this goes so deep in our ability to understand and implement decisions throughout the value chain
qualitative_analysis.justification: Deep organizational preparedness explicitly identified as prerequisite for cloud business model implementation.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Transition to the Cloud: A Vendor Perspective
qualitative_analysis.quote: partners will not sell unfinished products, and therefore, they will not be bought in unless the SaaS product from ERP Co is fully developed
qualitative_analysis.justification: Product quality and partner readiness identified as prerequisites for partner ecosystem engagement.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Business models and opportunity creation: How IT entrepreneurs create and develop business models under uncertainty
qualitative_analysis.quote: infrastructure technology needed for the platform would soon be ready... 3G permits were being granted... first mobile phones with color screens were coming onto the market
qualitative_analysis.justification: Infrastructure technology maturity (3G, devices) identified as evolving prerequisites for platform opportunity.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Business models and opportunity creation: How IT entrepreneurs create and develop business models under uncertainty
qualitative_analysis.quote: Would there be 3G networks? What would the cost of data transfer be? Would there be enough broadband capacity available?
qualitative_analysis.justification: Broadband capacity and data transfer costs identified as uncertain prerequisites affecting business model viability.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Business models and opportunity creation: How IT entrepreneurs create and develop business models under uncertainty
qualitative_analysis.quote: G-cluster needed game content... it was necessary to find network operators who had a broadband network with the IPTV feature
qualitative_analysis.justification: Game content and operator partnerships identified as prerequisites for gaming platform business model.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Revenue models, in-app purchase, and the app performance: Evidence from Apple's App Store and Google Play
qualitative_analysis.quote: the free revenue model requires a huge amount of users (critical mass) to attract a sufficient number of interested third parties, e.g., primarily advertisers but also info seekers, able to ensure developers' profitability
qualitative_analysis.justification: Critical mass of users identified as prerequisite for free/advertising revenue model viability.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Revenue models, in-app purchase, and the app performance: Evidence from Apple's App Store and Google Play
qualitative_analysis.quote: versioning can be optimal in presence of consumer heterogeneity
qualitative_analysis.justification: Consumer heterogeneity identified as market prerequisite for effective versioning and in-app purchase strategies.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Commercialization of Composite Software Resulting from Collaborative Research
qualitative_analysis.quote: each partner improved and adjusted his own software components to suite the compound solution. Thus, the resulting composite software solution is based on a value-network of interoperable independent software components and services
qualitative_analysis.justification: Interoperable components and partner value network identified as prerequisites for composite software model.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Commercialization of Composite Software Resulting from Collaborative Research
qualitative_analysis.quote: groups of independent complementary software providers with equal power
qualitative_analysis.justification: Equal power distribution among partners identified as prerequisite for viable loose partnership model.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Adjusting software revenue and pricing strategies in the era of cloud computing
qualitative_analysis.quote: SaaS providers are also extremely dependent on their suppliers. In many cases, they need access to IaaS and PaaS providers in order to make their services available to their customers
qualitative_analysis.justification: Access to IaaS/PaaS providers identified as critical infrastructure prerequisite for SaaS delivery.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Adjusting software revenue and pricing strategies in the era of cloud computing
qualitative_analysis.quote: all the case firms had planned their software architecture to be compatible with both the cloud environment and stand-alone implementations
qualitative_analysis.justification: Architecture compatible with multiple deployment models identified as prerequisite for flexible delivery.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Designing business models for cloud platforms
qualitative_analysis.quote: DP3 suggests that, from its launch onwards, PaaS should offer a set of complementary C&A
qualitative_analysis.justification: Initial set of complementary components identified as prerequisite for demonstrating platform value at launch.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Designing business models for cloud platforms
qualitative_analysis.quote: Customers rely on existing components to work efficiently on cloud platforms
qualitative_analysis.justification: Reliable existing components identified as prerequisite for customer platform adoption and efficiency.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Designing business models for cloud platforms
qualitative_analysis.quote: Resourcing as the process by which a platform's scope and diversity is enhanced, e.g. providing SDKs, APIs and a distribution channel
qualitative_analysis.justification: SDKs, APIs, and distribution channels identified as prerequisites enabling external platform development.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Business Models for Cloud Computing: Experiences from Developing Modeling & Simulation as a Service Applications in Industry
qualitative_analysis.quote: The CSSP uses multiple IaaS clouds provided by MT A SZT AKI (Hungary), BIFI (Spain), University of Westminster (UK), CloudSigma (Switzerland) and Amazon
qualitative_analysis.justification: Multiple IaaS cloud availability identified as infrastructure prerequisite for multi-cloud service deployment.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Business Models for Cloud Computing: Experiences from Developing Modeling & Simulation as a Service Applications in Industry
qualitative_analysis.quote: The main technology is the CloudSME Simulation Platform (CSSP) (shown in Figure 1), a PaaS that supports service provision, High Performance Computing (HPC) and multi-cloud deployment
qualitative_analysis.justification: PaaS platform development identified as prerequisite for service deployment and multi-cloud support.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Business Models for Cloud Computing: Experiences from Developing Modeling & Simulation as a Service Applications in Industry
qualitative_analysis.quote: The business venture is based on close partnership and collaboration amongst a number of key stakeholders
qualitative_analysis.justification: Stakeholder collaboration agreements identified as prerequisite for multi-party business model implementation.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: A Study on a Decentralized SaaS Business Model
qualitative_analysis.quote: local servers are belong to independent business entity
qualitative_analysis.justification: Independent business entities with local servers identified as prerequisite for decentralized SaaS model.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: A Study on a Decentralized SaaS Business Model
qualitative_analysis.quote: every local server may be required to provide certain applications (e.g. the brand products)
qualitative_analysis.justification: Standardized brand products from headquarters identified as prerequisite for service consistency.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Selection of the Proper Revenue and Pricing Model for SaaS
qualitative_analysis.quote: From the outset, the software architecture was designed to be compatible with both software renting and software licensing, depending on the customers' needs.
qualitative_analysis.justification: Architecture supporting dual revenue models identified as technical prerequisite for business model flexibility.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Selection of the Proper Revenue and Pricing Model for SaaS
qualitative_analysis.quote: If customers had already invested in IT infrastructure and their own IT personnel, they saw traditional software licensing as a more attractive choice.
qualitative_analysis.justification: Customer IT capabilities and infrastructure identified as prerequisites affecting revenue model selection.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Service-Centric Business Model in Cloud Environment
qualitative_analysis.quote: From the perspective of the relationship between IT and business operation, cloud has six essential technological advantages or cloud business enablers being used to power business model innovation
qualitative_analysis.justification: Cloud technological advantages identified as enablers prerequisite for business model innovation.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Designing Viable Multi-sided Data Platforms: The Case of Context-Aware Mobile Travel Applications
qualitative_analysis.quote: Advances in data semantification and natural language querying are enabling new generations of context-aware mobile applications
qualitative_analysis.justification: Data semantification technologies identified as evolving prerequisites enabling context-aware applications.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Designing Viable Multi-sided Data Platforms: The Case of Context-Aware Mobile Travel Applications
qualitative_analysis.quote: Sharing context information generated by a mobile application with other app developers risks violating user privacy
qualitative_analysis.justification: User privacy trust identified as prerequisite for data sharing in multi-sided platform models.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Economic and business perspectives on smartphones as multi-sided platforms
qualitative_analysis.quote: As multi-sided platforms, mobile operating systems have faced the chicken-and-egg problem
qualitative_analysis.justification: Solving chicken-and-egg problem identified as prerequisite challenge for platform business model emergence.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Economic and business perspectives on smartphones as multi-sided platforms
qualitative_analysis.quote: In late 2011 consumers purchasing a smartphone ranked the quality of the network of the mobile service provider as the top factor they considered in the purchase process
qualitative_analysis.justification: Network infrastructure quality identified as top prerequisite factor for smartphone platform adoption.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Crushing Candy: The Free-to-Play Game in Its Connective Commodity Form
qualitative_analysis.quote: Rather than being available on dedicated game devices or on a self-owned web-based portal, casual games such as Candy Crush are increasingly hosted and played on smartphones, tablets, and social network sites.
qualitative_analysis.justification: Platform access through app stores and social networks identified as distribution prerequisite for casual games.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Crushing Candy: The Free-to-Play Game in Its Connective Commodity Form
qualitative_analysis.quote: This low conversion rate of players into payers favors economies of scale and requires game studios to use a data-driven approach to game development and circulation in order to optimize, what industry insiders call "player monetization."
qualitative_analysis.justification: Large user base and data analytics capabilities identified as prerequisites for free-to-play monetization.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Effects of Freemium Strategy in the Mobile App Market: An Empirical Study of Google Play
qualitative_analysis.quote: For the Android consumers, Google Play (https://play.google.com) is such a one-stop shop for thousands of Android apps
qualitative_analysis.justification: Centralized marketplace identified as prerequisite for app distribution, discovery, and consumer access.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Effects of Freemium Strategy in the Mobile App Market: An Empirical Study of Google Play
qualitative_analysis.quote: a prerequisite for the freemium strategy to be effective is a minimum user satisfaction level with the free app
qualitative_analysis.justification: High-quality free app explicitly identified as prerequisite for effective freemium strategy implementation.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Network Externalities, Incumbent's Competitive Advantage and the Degree of Openness of Software Start-Ups
qualitative_analysis.quote: For sake of simplicity, we assume that customers are not hostile to OS solutions
qualitative_analysis.justification: Market acceptance of open source solutions identified as prerequisite assumption for OSS business models.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Network Externalities, Incumbent's Competitive Advantage and the Degree of Openness of Software Start-Ups
qualitative_analysis.quote: A necessary condition for non-maximal openness is that e ≥ e*
qualitative_analysis.justification: Strong network externalities identified as necessary condition for hybrid business model adoption.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: A Pricing Framework for Software-as-a-Service
qualitative_analysis.quote: SaaS is remotely hosted, meaning that software are deployed as hosted services to be accessed by clients from remote locations
qualitative_analysis.justification: Remote hosting infrastructure identified as prerequisite for SaaS deployment and delivery model.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: A Pricing Framework for Software-as-a-Service
qualitative_analysis.quote: The multi-tenant architecture of SaaS benefits both clients and vendors alike
qualitative_analysis.justification: Multi-tenant architecture identified as technical prerequisite providing mutual benefits in SaaS.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Clarifying the Value Elements of Business Models for Disturbance Management in Supply Chains
qualitative_analysis.quote: The solution is planned to work with Software as a Service (SaaS) principles (used and delivered through internet technology)
qualitative_analysis.justification: Internet technology identified as delivery prerequisite for SaaS-based supply chain solutions.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Clarifying the Value Elements of Business Models for Disturbance Management in Supply Chains
qualitative_analysis.quote: The basic principle behind the service is to collect systemically information about customer's transport disturbances to the information system
qualitative_analysis.justification: Systematic data collection capability identified as prerequisite for database-based service delivery.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: The Impact of Open Source Software Commercialization on Firm Value
qualitative_analysis.quote: appropriating returns from commercializing OSS products depends critically on firms' stocks of software patents and trademarks
qualitative_analysis.justification: Intellectual property portfolio identified as prerequisite for appropriating returns from OSS commercialization.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: The relationship between Open Innovation and Strategy: data-driven analysis of the Mobile Value Services Industry
qualitative_analysis.quote: Absorptive capacity and the integration of the acquired external knowledge are essential
qualitative_analysis.justification: Absorptive capacity identified as organizational prerequisite for integrating external knowledge in open innovation.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Open-Source Software Entrepreneurial Business Modelling
qualitative_analysis.quote: Built on top of the Business Model Canvas [8], the popular business modelling framework was customized for the specificities of the high-tech software business
qualitative_analysis.justification: Business modeling framework knowledge identified as prerequisite for OSS entrepreneurial development.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Towards a better Understanding of the Dynamics of Platform as a Service Business Models
qualitative_analysis.quote: Platforms in the software industry are defined as "… the extensible codebase of a software-based system that provides core functionality shared by the modules that interoperate with it and the interfaces through which they interoperate"
qualitative_analysis.justification: Extensible codebase with interfaces identified as architectural prerequisite for PaaS platform functionality.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Towards a better Understanding of the Dynamics of Platform as a Service Business Models
qualitative_analysis.quote: PaaS as an execution environment in which external developers deploy and run their complementary components and applications
qualitative_analysis.justification: Execution environment for external developers identified as technical prerequisite for PaaS business model.
